III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
The facility has more than adequate space to accommodate administrative functions for
the required staff and to maintain confidentiality of placement/services records. The
area includes the appropriate shredder and secure storage area required. The building
is a large brick structure with a number of rooms that can be modified for program
development. The expectation is for initial participants to be placed in host homes rather
than this structure. The building also contains additional space that can be modified
and used for meeting rooms/visitation and office space as needed to meet the needs for
administrative functions.
B. Program Description CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
This program will provide supervision of youth placed in independent living in host
homes. It will serve youth from Bay and Arenac Counties. The program will provide
services to both male and female youth, ages 16-22 years old who have runaway, are
at risk of running away, are homeless, at risk of homelessness, or are in crisis with
family. Individual and family case management will be provided to the youth and their
2

legal parents/caregiver. This program will not accept any youth who are adjudicated,
DHHS wards, and/or who have an open CPS case. It will not accept youth with severe
disabilities. They must be in an age range of 16-17 years at the time of initial
acceptance, but youth may remain in care if they are already admitted, until they reach
the end age for services. No youth aged 18 or over will be admitted.
Host homes for placement will be recruited and trained to meet all safety standards, but
they will not be licensed as foster homes by the agency.
The agency will employ sufficient staff that meet all licensing requirements to provide
supervision and documentation of services consistent with all applicable licensing
requirements for independent living.
A statement of need and an acceptable projected budget have been submitted.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no violations noted and documentation indicates an
intention to maintain compliance.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-
month original license be issued.
